org.js4ms.channels
Class MessageOutputMap<MessageType>

java.lang.Object
  org.js4ms.channels.MessageOutputMap<MessageType>
Type Parameters:
MessageType - The message object type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageOutput<MessageType>
public final class MessageOutputMap<MessageType>
extends Object
implements MessageOutput<MessageType>

An message channel that routes an incoming message to one in a set of message channels. The message output channel is chosen using a key value extracted from the message. The message channel map only allows one channel per key value. A channel added previously can be replaced by adding a different channel using the same key value. A thread should not attempt to add or remove channels while executing in the send(Object, int) method as this may result in an exception.

Author:
Greg Bumgardner (gbumgard)
See Also:
MessageKeyExtractor

send

public final void send(MessageType message,
                       int milliseconds)
                throws IOException,
                       InterruptedIOException,
                       InterruptedException
Description copied from interface: MessageOutput
Attempts to send a message to a message sink within a specified amount of time.

Some channel implementations may choose to accept the static object EOM to indicate that the caller has stopped producing messages.

Specified by:
send in interface MessageOutput<MessageType>
Parameters:
message - A MessageType object or the static object EOM (if supported).
milliseconds - The amount of time allotted to complete the operation.
Throws:
IOException - The send operation has failed.
InterruptedIOException - The send operation was interrupted or timed out.
InterruptedException - The calling thread was interrupted before the send operation could complete.
